title: Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB: When the tab character in the first line is replaced with spaces so that both lines are visually indented the same, executing ShiftLeft does not move the text. It is unclear how this behavior is specified, but in the first scenario, it appears that the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left until the space character (i.e., get rid of the tab). Regardless, if there is a stray space, it is confusing as to why the text won't shift.
EB: When the tab character in the first line is replaced with spaces so that both lines are visually indented the same, executing ShiftLeft should move the text. In the first scenario, the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left until the space character (i.e., get rid of the tab). If there is a stray space, it should not prevent the text from shifting.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that both lines are indented the same visually.
2. Execute ShiftLeft.
3. Verify that the text moves as expected, with the second line shifted left and the first line shifted left until the space character (if any).
